newsitem.title: JAPAN: Three Japan refiners to raise topper capacity - MITI.
newsitem.headline: Three Japan refiners to raise topper capacity - MITI.

text.p: Refiners Tonen Corp, Kygnus Sekiyu Seisei KK and Taiyo Oil Co Ltd will raise their crude processing capacity by a total of 35,000 barrels per day (bpd) this year, the Trade Ministry said on Monday.

Tonen will raise the capacity of the No 1 crude distillation unit (CDU) at its Kawasaki plant, near Tokyo, by 15,000 bpd to 80,000 bpd in September, the Ministry of International Trade and Industry's (MITI) Agency of Natural Resources and Energy said.
Tonen's total crude processing capacity will become 421,000 bpd as a result of the expansion.
Kygnus Sekiyu Seisei will expand the capacity of its Kawasaki topper, the refiner's sole CDU, by 10,000 bpd to 80,000 bpd in June, an agency official said.
Taiyo Oil plans to raise the output capacity of its two toppers at the Kikuma plant on Shikoku, the smallest of Japan's four main islands, by a total 10,000 bpd.
The capacity of the first topper will be raised by 8,000 bpd to 67,000 bpd in August, and the second CDU by 2,000 bpd to 32,000 bpd in September, the agency official said.
Japan's total crude processing capacity will reach 5.305 million barrels-per-stream-day following the expansion by the three refiners.
